description.narrative: The direct target group consists of 75 young people, 12 – 18 years of age, from all municipalities in Bengo province, who have concluded primary school and express their interest and willingness to participate in the challenging program. They will be recruited to start the first year of the program in February 2015. During the enrolment process meetings will be held with prospective students and their parents to make sure that they understand and want to follow the program of the school. ;

The new program, developed in cooperation with the Ministry of Education, is a Basic Academic and Technical Education, known as EPP, from the Portuguese “Escolas Polivalentes e Profissionais”. The three year courses combine regular schooling with vocational subjects and successful students will graduate with a nationally recognized academic and vocational certificate, corresponding to 9th grade. On graduation they will be able to continue to the next level of education (upper secondary) or find employment / start their own enterprise. ;

The overall objectives of the project are: •To offer Angolan youth a lower secondary education through which they acquire academic and practical skills, as well as general knowledge and life skills to enable them to become productive citizens, able to create a good life for themselves and their families and to contribute to the development of the country •To contribute to a better educated and more productive workforce in Angola
Objectives of the project The specific objectives of the project are: 1.To support 75 young people for the full three years of the EPP program (Team 2015) 2.To establish and maintain an Alumni Network 3.To develop a professional business strategy ;
